body.p:
Franklin Ky,
11" July 1863,
Gov James. F. Robinson,
Frankfort Ky
Sir,

During the early part of last Winter, a most cruel and malicious murder was committed in this (Simpson Co) on the person of Mike Shawler by one John J. Bell, who has Since fled & is now at large & a fugitive from Justice -- The wicked & cruel circumstances attending the murder, ought to induce your Excellency to offer a reward for the apprehension of the guilty perpetrator of the crime -- the poverty of the Decd's family renders it impossible for them to offer a reward, and without it, in all probability
will never be brought to Justice -- I hope therefore, your Excellency will offer a reasonable reward for the apprehension of said Bell --

Bell is about 29 years old, Spare made, light hair, about 5 feet 11 inches high -- inclined to be Stooped Shouldered -- appearance of being disipated -- very quiet, & never talks unless spoken to, and his Eyes appear to be defective --

Wm Kidd
County Court Judge, Simpson co

I, as County attorney, had occasion to investigate the facts of the foregoing case of murder, & Know it was cruel & without any circumstance of mitigation -- & Join in asking the Govr to offer a reasonable Reward --

James W. Tate,
asst. Secr'y State,
If the Govr offers a reward Send me a paper containing the proclamation immediately, and I will have Some Notices Struck -- from it --

Simpson Co.
$200. Reward for Jno. J Bell for murder of M. Shawler
Issd July 13. 1863.
Reward to be given send copy as requested.
